intro: Uragoga fuscostipulata, commonly known as the black-stippled uragoga, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dark green leaves with distinctive black stipules along the leaf stalks. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Uragoga fuscostipulata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments.
